intro: Parnassia yudzuruana, commonly known as the Yudzuruan lady's mantle, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It is noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
